basic_info.content: Loyola Marymount University (LMU) is a private Jesuit research university located in Los Angeles, California. Founded in 1911, LMU serves over 9,000 students across undergraduate and graduate programs.
LMU's main campus is located in the Westchester area of Los Angeles, near LAX airport. The campus features modern facilities, beautiful architecture, and stunning views of the Pacific Ocean.

LMU offers undergraduate degrees through six schools: Bellarmine College of Liberal Arts, College of Business Administration, School of Education, Seaver College of Science and Engineering, School of Film and Television, and College of Communication and Fine Arts.
The LMU Lions compete in NCAA Division I athletics. Popular sports include basketball, soccer, tennis, and volleyball. The Gersten Pavilion hosts basketball and volleyball games.

campus_locations.name: The Bluff
campus_locations.description: That's what we call our entire campus - it's literally on a bluff overlooking LA with the best views fr fr

campus_locations.name: U-Hall
campus_locations.description: University Hall - the main admin building where you go for everything from transcripts to parking passes

campus_locations.name: The Lair
campus_locations.description: Main dining hall where everyone vibes and gets their grub. The food is lowkey fire sometimes

campus_locations.name: Burns Backcourt
campus_locations.description: The outdoor dining area behind Burns Rec Center - perfect for studying in the sun and people watching

campus_locations.name: Gersten
campus_locations.description: Gersten Pavilion - where basketball games go down and it gets LIT. The student section goes crazy fr

campus_locations.name: The Library
campus_locations.description: William H. Hannon Library - your study spot when you need to grind. Gets packed during finals week ðŸ’€

campus_locations.name: Sunken Gardens
campus_locations.description: The beautiful garden area in the middle of campus - perfect for photos and chilling

campus_locations.name: Greek Row
campus_locations.description: Where all the frats and sororities are located - the social scene is wild

campus_locations.name: The Village
campus_locations.description: Off-campus housing area where upperclassmen live - it's like a mini college town

campus_locations.name: C-Store
campus_locations.description: Campus store for snacks, drinks, and essentials. Your late night snack spot

student_life.content: First Fridays are monthly events with free food and activities - literally the best way to meet people
Lion Dollars are campus currency for laundry, vending machines, and some dining locations
LMU CARES is the campus wellness and support program - they're literally there for you
PROWL is the student portal where you register for classes and check grades - basically your academic lifeline
LionsConnect is where you find clubs and organizations - there's literally something for everyone
The campus vibe is super chill - everyone's friendly and the weather is literally perfect year-round
Greek life is pretty big here - rush week is wild and the parties are legendary
The bluff views are literally everything - you can see the ocean and downtown LA from campus

events.title: Study Abroad Information Session
events.description: Learn about LMU's study abroad programs in over 40 countries. Pizza will be provided!

events.title: Career Fair - Tech & Engineering
events.description: Meet with top tech companies and engineering firms. Bring your resume!

events.title: Mental Health Awareness Workshop
events.description: Join CPS for a workshop on stress management and wellness strategies.

events.title: Lions Basketball vs USC
events.description: Cheer on the Lions at our rivalry game! Free t-shirts for students.

events.title: Taco Tuesday at the Lair
events.description: Special taco bar with build-your-own options. $2 tacos all day!

events.title: First Friday: Welcome Back Bash
events.description: Kick off the semester with free food, games, and live music! Meet new people and get hyped for the year.

events.title: Midnight Breakfast
events.description: Free breakfast during finals week! Because studying is hard enough without being hangry.

faqs.content:
Q: How do I register for classes?
A: Students register for classes through PROWL (LMU's student portal). Registration dates are assigned based on class standing and credit hours. Check your registration date in PROWL and prepare an alternate schedule in case your preferred classes are full.

Q: Where can I find my academic advisor?
A: Your academic advisor assignment depends on your major. Check PROWL for your advisor's contact information, or contact your department directly. Advisors help with course planning, degree requirements, and academic guidance.

Q: How do I apply for financial aid?
A: Complete the FAFSA (Free Application for Federal Student Aid) by the priority deadline. LMU's school code is 001234. Also complete the CSS Profile for institutional aid. Contact the Financial Aid office for assistance.

Q: What are the library hours?
A: The William H. Hannon Library is typically open Monday-Thursday 7:30 AM to 2:00 AM, Friday 7:30 AM to 8:00 PM, Saturday 9:00 AM to 8:00 PM, and Sunday 10:00 AM to 2:00 AM. Hours may vary during finals week and holidays.

Q: How do I get involved on campus?
A: LMU has over 200 student organizations. Attend the Activities Fair at the beginning of each semester, check LionsConnect for organizations, or start your own group. Popular activities include Greek life, cultural organizations, academic clubs, and service groups.

Q: Where can I get tutoring help?
A: The Academic Resource Center (ARC) in the library offers free tutoring for many subjects. You can also find subject-specific tutoring through departments, peer tutoring programs, or the Writing Center for help with papers and presentations.

Q: How do I report a maintenance issue in my dorm?
A: Report maintenance issues through the Residence Life portal or call the Facilities Management work order desk. For emergencies (no heat, water leaks, safety issues), call Campus Safety immediately.

Q: What meal plan options are available?
A: LMU offers several meal plan options including unlimited dining, block plans (14, 10, or 5 meals per week), and commuter plans. All residential students are required to have a meal plan. Plans include Lion Cash for use at retail locations.

Q: Where's the best place to study on campus?
A: The library is lowkey packed during finals week ðŸ’€ but Burns Backcourt is perfect for outdoor studying when the weather's nice. The library has quiet floors and group study rooms too.

Q: How do I get Lion Dollars?
A: You can add Lion Dollars to your student account through PROWL or at the Campus Card office. They're perfect for laundry, vending machines, and some dining spots.

Q: What's the vibe like at basketball games?
A: Gersten gets LIT during basketball games fr fr! The student section goes crazy and it's literally the best way to show school spirit. Free t-shirts and sometimes free food too.

academic.content: The academic year at LMU consists of two semesters (fall and spring) plus optional summer sessions. Each semester is approximately 15 weeks long. Finals week occurs at the end of each semester.

To maintain good academic standing, undergraduate students must maintain a cumulative GPA of 2.0 or higher. Students below this threshold may be placed on academic probation and must meet with an academic advisor.

The pass/no pass grading option allows students to take certain courses without affecting their GPA. Students must declare pass/no pass by the deadline (usually mid-semester). Some courses and majors do not allow pass/no pass grading.

LMU's core curriculum includes requirements in theology, philosophy, history, literature, science, mathematics, and fine arts. All undergraduate students must complete these requirements regardless of major.
Students can appeal grades by first discussing with the instructor, then the department chair, and finally the dean of the school. Grade appeals must be filed within one year of receiving the grade.
